title: Run Localization docker image on AWS
body:
Notes: 
$ aws ecr create-repository --repository-name localization --profile orcatag --region eu-north-1

{
    "repository": {
        "registryId": "242085886101", 
        "repositoryName": "localization", 
        "repositoryArn": "arn:aws:ecr:eu-north-1:242085886101:repository/localization", 
        "createdAt": 1548784132.0, 
        "repositoryUri": "242085886101.dkr.ecr.eu-north-1.amazonaws.com/localization"
    }
}


$ `aws ecr get-login --no-include-email --region eu-north-1 --profile orcatag`


$ docker tag localization:latest 242085886101.dkr.ecr.eu-north-1.amazonaws.com/localization:latest


In the EC2 instance: 


   12  sudo yum update
   13  sudo amazon-linux-extras install docker 
   14  sudo usermod -a -G docker ec2-user
   15  sudo systemctl enable docker
   16  docker info
   17  sudo reboot
   24  docker info
   25  aws configure
   26  aws ecr get-login --no-include-email --region eu-north-1
   27  `aws ecr get-login --no-include-email --region eu-north-1`
   28  aws ecr describe-images --repository-name localization
   29  aws ecr list-images --repository-name localization
   30  docker pull 242085886101.dkr.ecr.eu-north-1.amazonaws.com/localization
   31  docker images
   32  docker run -d -p 8000:8000 localization
   33  docker run -d -p 8000:8000 242085886101.dkr.ecr.eu-north-1.amazonaws.com/localization
   34  docker ps

title: AWS Lambda function to re-size the pictures.
Look into https://wildbook.org
body: Can we reuse parts of it in our project, or could Norwegian Orca Survey use it as it is?

title: Propose graphical design (logo, fonts, colors, etc)
Create S3-bucket
body: ... with access policy to be used for storing the uploaded pictures.

title: Develop a REST-service that can be called from the 'upload command'
body:
Develop a REST-service with endpoints for: 
- uploading pictures into folders
- listing pictures and folders
- etc.

Must have some simple authentication mechanism, possibly basic auth with a username/password stored in a properties file to start with, but eventually stored in a database or similar.

title: Develop the 'upload command'
body:
Initially the command will call a mockup representing the REST-service to actually upload the pictures.

The upload command must:
* parse parameters as defined in issue #3.
* if not invoked with all the parameters: print 'usage' to show required parameters 
* prompt the user for a password
* count the files in the directory
* loop through all the files
 * check that they are not empty
 * check that the files are in a supported format (how?)
 * print progress ("file x of y uploaded")
* initially call a service mockup
* the service will eventually call a REST-service to actually upload the pictures

title: Define the parameters that the 'upload command' will take as input
body: Build on https://github.com/bjornhjelle/orcatag/blob/master/doc/functional_design.md and define input parameters to 'upload command'.

title: Have Mikkel, Bethan, Scott and Bjørn sign NDAs
Snakke med NOS om dette
body:
list of male/female pictures in a dropbox folder

list of files per category (as on the web site)

ask about tags for the 1000 pictures

if someone else has a partially 'defined dataset'
